meanings.definition: Lacking material substance; not solid or tangible.
meanings.sent1: The ghostly figure was unsubstantial, disappearing into thin air.
meanings.sent2: Her argument was based on unsubstantial evidence, making it hard to believe.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked so unsubstantial that it seemed to vanish before our eyes!
meanings.sent4: His promises turned out to be as unsubstantial as a shadow in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The dream felt unsubstantial, slipping away as soon as she woke up.

meanings.definition: Lacking real importance or value; insubstantial.
meanings.sent1: The gossip about her was unsubstantial and quickly forgotten.
meanings.sent2: His excuses for being late were always unsubstantial and unconvincing.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations looked so unsubstantial that they almost seemed like a joke!
meanings.sent4: The friendship turned out to be as unsubstantial as a bubble that popped.
meanings.sent5: The praise felt unsubstantial, lacking the sincerity she craved.
